borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt;">2.&nbsp;<span style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif">The proposed development fails to provide an acceptable quality of accommodation to facilitate a good standard of living&nbsp;by reason of inadequate provision of internal and external amenity space for a two bedroom, 1 storey, 3 person flat. In addition the poor&nbsp;access arrangement does not faciliate reasonable or high quality street to door access, which also presents an unacceptable standard of accomodation. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</span></span></p><p style="line-height:normal; margin-bottom:0cm; margin-left:54.0pt; margin-right:0cm; margin-top:0cm; mso-add-space:auto; mso-layout-grid-align:none; subdivision_of_building: GROUND & FIRST-FLOOR INTERNAL ALTERATIONS TO INCLUDE THE SELF-CONTAINMENT OF THE FIRST-FLOOR FLAT WITH NEW ACCESS FROM A NEW REAR STAIRCASE.
description: Construction of a new rear access staircase to the first floor accommodation to make it a self-contained 2xbed flat, involving internal alterations to the ground floor shop and first floor

constraints_details.result: Accomodation Above, 113 Ripple Road, Barking, Barking And Dagenham,
